intro: Hieraciodes oporinodes, commonly known as the narrow-leafed hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and slightly lobed, with a hairy texture, and the flowers are yellow with ray florets. It blooms from late spring to early summer, producing seeds that are dispersed by wind.
